text: You didn't like the credits theme or Marie's theme, Supra? Thought those were the best on the OST, imo ...
author: Snow Eskimo Jo

text: I'd agree. Techno, dubstep, rock, they work a lot of times with fighting games but I enjoy some variety and it gets old to me when a company repeatedly uses such melodies for their fighting games. And as such, it makes it feel as though Capcom's been hitting generic strands lately, not releasing games because they want to but because it'll make money. It's one reason I love platformers and RPGs so much, varied soundtracks.

text: The game is INCREDIBLY fun, the OST great and the artwork amazing. Only issues I have are some of the same issues I had with MVC2 due to overlapping mechanics. But still an awesome game and I actually enjoy it more than MVC2.
author: xOmniCloudx

text: Yamane's style is immediately recognizable in this track. This could fit right in one of the portable Metroidvanias for the DS, especially the part at 1:45. I must say though, apart from a couple tracks like this one, I was mostly disapointed by this game's soundtrack. Being composed by Yamane, I was expecting something more memorable. I personally find she reached her masterful prime with SotN.

text: Have you heard the theme for Big Band's stage? It's called Unfinished Business and it's jazzy as hell
